context: The Estonian word 'lähe' is the imperative singular form of the verb 'minema', which means 'to go'. It's used as a command or suggestion to someone (singular) to go somewhere. The base infinitive is 'minema', and it appears in different forms: lähen (I go), lähed (you go), läheme (we go), lähete (you all go), lähedavad (they go).
